main_definition: A pair refers to a set of two items that are similar or related in some way, often used as a unit.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Two objects designed for use together.
meanings_and_examples.example: When you wear socks and shoes, they make up a pair.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A couple or two individuals in a romantic relationship.
meanings_and_examples.example: They are happily married and have been a loving pair for over 20 years.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Two similar items, often of the same type or kind.
meanings_and_examples.example: You can buy a pair of gloves to keep your hands warm during winter.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A set of two things that go together or are complementary in function.
meanings_and_examples.example: The right tool for the job is often referred to as part of a 'pair' with its counterpart.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Two people who work closely together, typically at the same job or task.
meanings_and_examples.example: She and her colleague make an excellent pair when working on projects due to their complementary skills.
